intro: Rabiea albipuncta var. major, commonly known as the white-spotted nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves with a slightly heart-shaped base. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Its botanical characteristics include a robust root system and the ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. This species is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands.
